solution_line_template: The old refrigerator costs ${old_daily_cost} a day so for {num_days} days it costs {old_daily_cost}*{num_days} = $<<{old_daily_cost}*{num_days}={old_monthly_cost}>>{old_monthly_cost}
The new refrigerator costs ${new_daily_cost} a day so for {num_days} days it costs {new_daily_cost}*{num_days} =$<<{new_daily_cost}*{num_days}={new_monthly_cost}>>{new_monthly_cost}
Over {num_days} days, Kurt saves {old_monthly_cost}-{new_monthly_cost} = $<<{old_monthly_cost}-{new_monthly_cost}={savings}>>{savings} a month with his new refrigerator
